title: JavadoubleKeyword

metadata.description: Learn about JavadoubleKeyword with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
double myNum = 19.99d;
System.out.println(myNum);

Definition and Usage
The
double
keyword is a data type that can store fractional numbers from 1.7e−308 to 1.7e+308.
Note that you should end the value with a "d":
Related Pages
Read more about data types in our
Java Data Types Tutorial
.

★
+1

The
double
keyword?
options: a data type that can store fractional numbers from 1

The correct definition of Definition and Usage
The
double
keyword is 'a data type that can store fractional numbers from 1'.

summary: This tutorial covers JavadoubleKeyword concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use JavadoubleKeyword effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples.
